Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation EVER”
Reviews.Author: s c
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in April 2012 and it was beautiful!!! The room more than accomodated myself, my husband, and our three kids. The appearance of the outside of the hotel was not as inviting as the pictures made it out to be but it was fantastic inside! We were literally a 4 minute walk from the shoreline of the ocean! There are TONS of restaurants very near the hotel, a CVS pharmacy with everything you could ever need and the staff at the hotel was amazing! Willing to help with directions, suggestions of things to do, reviews of their experiences and just overall friendly people. My only complaint would be the "continental breakfast" that is a huge overstatement. There are some danishes in a cabinet...no plates no tables

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Experiences
Reviews.Content: This place was the worst place we stayed after travelling down from San Francisco. The breakfast was poor and consisted of small muffins, there was no WIFI at all and the nearest place was in a library in San Diego. The room was small and stuffy. Unfortunately there was a power cut across San Diego when we stayed there which lasted from 4pm through until 4am! The owner didnt even have any candles or tourch lights he could hand round to his guests - in fact he simply had an attitude of 'couldnt care less' about him! The only good thing about this place was its location near the sea front, I would even say it was over priced. There are so many places to stay in San Diego - I just dont know how they get away with such poor quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location - happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: abqwolfe
Reviews.Content: One never knows whether the reviews are true, but The Pacific Shores really is a hidden gem. The rates are very low for a property so close to the beach. We were four adults in a double queen room and we were VERY comfortable! We had hoped to have a double queen room upstairs with an “L” shaped double window (lots of sunlight) and a balcony with a table and chairs to enjoy coffee in the mornings, but the hotel was completely booked. Management graciously offered to move us the next day, but we decided to stay where we were (besides, it turned out that the weather was rainy and windy and too cold to sit outside anyway!!) Our room was huge and had vaulted ceilings which made it look even larger; and the décor was very pleasant and most important - it was super CLEAN! There was a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room as well and we enjoyed brewing coffee in the room daily (coffee/filter combination packets are available at the desk – just ask!) Every morning there were freshly delivered pastries, coffee, juice and tea available in the office – perfect to start the day. It was also nice to have an iron and ironing board and there was a hairdryer in the bathroom. As for toiletries, we always bring our own, but I love that there was Bath & Body Works soap and shampoo available. The beach really is just across the parking lot and we felt totally safe walking out there after dark. As other posts mentioned, there are many restaurants, bars, shops, etc. within a few blocks – the Pacific Shores is very convenient to everything. We walked around and explored every evening and found cool places every time. However, since we had a car, we drove around quite a bit and got lost on purpose just to explore the area! We ate at The Menu, The Broken Yolk, Ciro’s Pizzeria and Bar (which were all within a short drive) and our last night we went to World Famous just a few blocks from our hotel which was recommended by a local couple we met at The Menu. We had a great getaway and the Pacific Shores was perfect base to come back and rest. Housekeeping does a fabulous job (they were even washing the sidewalks and patios!) and the front desk staff was always friendly, courteous and helpful. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel – look no further – the Pacific Shores is perfect. PS – I am one who researches hotels on TripAdvisor exhaustively and I drive myself crazy second-guessing my decisions. I was so happy to find that the reviews on this property are absolutely spot-on. I also was impressed that the manager actually reads the reviews and personally replies to the guests – that played a huge role in deciding on booking the Pacific Shores! Kudos, Mr. Silver – you run an A+ operation and have a to-notch staff.

Reviews.Title: “quiet family friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Joy K
Reviews.Content: we stayed for two nights in a great room with double beds. we loved the view and simple breakfast. you cannot beat the location and the easy access to the beach. some members of our family have never been to San Diego or seen the Pacific and they were so impressed with this charming hotel. we will be sure to be back in the summer. this will now be the only place I stay in San Diego from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jock25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 Nights in March 2012. We had a king room at the bottom of the complex. We were very suprised at the size of the room it was big . We also had a big kitchen with a Hob, microwave, refrigerator, Table and Chairs and loads of storage space. It was like we had rented a condo. Location great next to the beach we could see the sea from our kitchen window. Customer Service was great, free parking, free continental breakfast, value for money excellent. If I come back to San Diego I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2012”
Reviews.Author: barronbjjs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the biggest suite at this hotel and although the suite was very large and ideal for four people, the conditions were lacking in cleanliness. This is a hotel that could use a major make over because location and customer service were great. I wish that the larger suties were located in the back of the hotel because our view was of street and the traffic in and out of the lobby. The beds were comfortable and kitchen was stocked with supplies. The pool was in great condition and maintained well. I am not sure that I will return but location is ideal. If you are not a snob, then this is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Shores Inn a pleasant surprise.....”
Reviews.Author: Jopalis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pacific Shores Inn for one night on in April 2012. It's in a great location but unlike the Ocean Park Inn which is in the heart of all the partying, this location is quiet. The room had what appeared to be some fairly recent nice upgrades. Nice stall shower, granite counters...Nice refrigerator and microwave. There did appear to be some additional repairs needed but nothing serious...beat up cabinetry under bathroom counter, rust and damage to back of bathroom door...probably some caused by the open shower and a rather flimsy makeshift repair to the sliding door lock. Nice linens, clean room. Only one bar of soap so had to switch between shower and sink. One tiny bottle of shampoo and that's it. In all the room met our needs and we rested well. The continental breakfast was lacking. The only thing provided was coffee/tea, dry creamer, sugar, sweeteners, juice and some baked goods. No cereal, milk, half and half, yogurt or any fresh fruit. I think they should improve this. I have never experienced such a limited continental breakfast. I would stay there again though and the staff was very courteous and friendly. If they made improvements to some of the mentioned things I would have rated higher.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: Stayed only two nights (3/11-3/13) but what a reprieve it was. Arrived early (11:30 am) but front desk gave us a parking pass so we could walk some where for lunch. Many restaurants nearby to eat and enjoy the ocean view. Came back at 1:30 to change for the beach and a room was ready. Great 2nd floor room with partial view of ocean. Listened to the ocean in the night while a sleep was peaceful. Office management & staff were great! Been coming for 20 + years to this inn. This was by far the best. Loved the renovated rooms. Very short walk to the beach. Enjoyed the tea & pastries in the morning. Laundry facilities for those longer trips. Good size refrigerator in room for cold drinks and leftovers. Will always come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne250
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Pacific Shores Inn 4 times in the last year and would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone. The location is close enough to walk to all lots of shops and restaurants but far enough for a quiet and peaceful stay and of course the beach is only steps away. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Rooms are large, clean and nicely decorated. The only thing I would have loved having is a hot tub by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “We accidentally booked this motel”
Reviews.Author: Lawflake
Reviews.Content: We accidentally booked this motel instead of Pacific Terrace Inn so we were disappointed as Pacific Terrace Inn is a beautiful oceanfront property while Pacific Shores Inn is basic property located between the oceanfront and Mission Blvd. The Inn is clean, well located and an exceptional value. The rooms lack basic amenities like coffee (but there is a pot in the closet) and a channel directory. We had to call for towels to use the pool and eventually went to get them ourselves. There is no hot tub and the pool is not really heated although they say it is.It is too cold to use. Breakfast is cheap pastry, room temperature juice and tepid coffee. We could hear the neighbors upstairs arguing. Still the place is a great value and the cleaning crew does a superb job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: lainey1234
Reviews.Content: Great location in Pacific Beach. They exagerate the ocean view a little bit, but it's a short walk to the boardwalk overlooking a great beach. Walking distance to a few shops and some great restaurants. Breakfast was very sparse - pastries, juice and coffee. Footsteps upstairs VERY noisy. Never before have I had a hotel leave half-used bottles of shampoo. In spite of rationally knowing there was nothing wrong with those bottles, it kind of creeped me out. Only small negatives. The big issues were all great. Nice room, clean, refrigerator, microwave, pool (didn't actually get in it due to weather, but looked nice), friendly staff, PARKING - all the stuff that really matters was great. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: rinny_rem
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here when visiting San Diego. It's reasonably priced, the staff is always friendly and helpful and the location is great. It's just beyond the central business area of Pacific Beach close enough to walk to shops and restaurants but far enough to be quiet for a good night's sleep. The rooms are a good size and always clean.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location and a clean motel”
Reviews.Author: kks1177
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with this place. Just a block from the ocean and boardwalk, in Pacific Beach. Clean, large rooms. Comfortable beds. Quiet area. Walking distance to cafes, restaurants, and bars. Friendly staff. Continental breakfast was fine. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: georgie773
Reviews.Content: This was our second long term stay at Pacific Shores. Great overall value for the price and location, only a few hundred yards from Pacific Beach. The staff and housekeeping were very helpful, with many familiar faces we had seen from our last trip. So many places have constant turnovers, it's nice to see a place that has the same employees from a year ago. Jim Silver, the Manager, did a super job of accommodating our plans . We didn't know which day we would be arriving and Jim did a great job of moving things around last minute to give us the room we wanted. Rooms are spacious, with a lot of new renovations. Great restaurants close by, especially World Famous! We will definitely be back! Thanks Jim!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Denise J
Reviews.Content: Our room was surprisingly mondern, clean and large. The staff was friendly and helpful. It's not a fancy place, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Terri A
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping staff is wonderful. No matter when we came back, our room was cleaned and ready. They were friendly and always had a smile. Everything was clean, neat and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: LilMissTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice motel on the beach, and if the rates stay low (which they should, due to the thin walls), then you'll love your stay here. If you pay more than $100, you'll probably be a little upset. Also, if you book your hotel via a booking service (e.g. Orbitz), make sure you print your reservation out, along with the rate, as the clerk was unable to find our reservation. We had to show him the email confirmation. The Great: -AMAZING location is a beautiful area (Mission Beach). If you have never been to Mission Beach, add it to your to-go list. The motel is right on the beach. -Value - I am pretty sure I got a steal due to it being off-season (got the place for around $90) and if the rates stay that way, I'd consider this a great value. -Big rooms, very spacious, comfortable and clean. The ceilings are SKY HIGH on the second floor above the parking spaces. I loved how high the ceilings were. Very comfy beds. The Bad: -Incredibly thin walls and windows. I was on the second floor and I could literally hear people on the street coughing. It's unfortunate how thin the windows/walls are. However, at night, I did find peace and quiet and didn't hear any activity or loud noises. I did turn on the heater unit just for the "white noise." -No free WiFi! Terrible. They charge $8 a day for WiFi and the signal is bad. -Poor cell phone reception in the motel area. No one in our party had good reception and we were all on different networks (this is obviously NOT the motel's fault but it's worth noting). The motel is in a great location, central to several wonderful bars and restaurants. We recommend Fat Fish, as it served great food and margaritas, and Taco Surf Shop. You'll find plentiful bars/restaurants to check out, along with chain restaurants, Ralph's, CVS and shopping stores all within walking distance from the motel. Parking is free. We stayed in rooms above the parking on the second floor and those are the rooms that had sky high ceilings. Highly recommend those. There were other motels nearby that we walked by and this place seemed nicer (on appearance) than those. But man, the walls/windows are sooooo thin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort with first class customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa44881
Reviews.Content: Wow,what a pleasant suprise. Pacific Shores Inn on Pacific Beach is one of San Diego's best kept secrets.Our room was very clean and cozy. All of the employees at the front desk (ESPECIALLY KARLA) were warm,friendly and extremely helpful with the many questions we had to ask.The hotel is close to tons of restaurants and shopping. Taco Surf is about a half block down the street and it is delicious,(thanks again to Karla for the recommendation.) The walls are thin so beware of late Saturday night parties in the room next to you but other than that expect a wonderful stay. A big thank you to all the staff at Pacific Shores Inn!!! I hope to come visit you again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay close to PB.”
Reviews.Author: rents_12
Reviews.Content: My son chose this place for us as a gift to us for xmas. Nice place to stay, close to beach. Staff was excellent, room clean. We were downstairs, backdoor to sidewalk. I wish we had chairs to sit outside. My son brought us over chairs. Would of been more convienent for Inn to supply the chairs. Bed was comfortable, staff was friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price and good location”
Reviews.Author: liima
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for three days. The room was big with two big and confortable double beds. Bathroom newly renovated and nice but small. Very nice staff. Good location very close to the ocean. On the downside: The "kitchen" was a microwave and a fridge. The cleening staff took our used soap when cleening but didn't leave us a new one. The breakfast was coffee, orangejuice and sweet muffins or similar. Overall good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: peggygris
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, nice pool, well maintained property, very close to beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Katieazgal
Reviews.Content: This was our families second stay here and I dont think we will stay anywhere else. You can't beat the rates for the location! Theres plenty of great places to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay $$$ more for luxury? Value is where this place wins!”
Reviews.Author: sekaitraveller
Reviews.Content: You can have a perfect stay for $300 a night at a hotel nearby but I much prefer having a perfect stay for $75 a night (low season midweek December). In truth, poor stays can happen at any price point. Go ahead and pay for luxury. I think if you've paid $300 for a room, you've paid for the right to complain! If you stay here, appreciate the incredible value! This is a great place and is making a good effort to set itself apart from other hotels in the areas. For the price of a hostel stay, we got 2 queen beds, a flat screen, a vaulted ceiling and a partial ocean view for the small balcony (Room 67). We were comfortable, it was quiet and we were very happy with our choice. If I was paying $300 for the room, I would say that the door is showing age and the bed sheets / towels could be thicker/newer but we didn't pay that much, so we're not going to complain!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NihalPeeris
Reviews.Content: very good ,friendly staff,value for money,breakfast little choice,close to city center

Reviews.Title: “Great location right on the beach, close to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: kismika
Reviews.Content: This great, cozy hotel is located right on the beach, literally just few steps away from the ocean. But keep in mind that due to hotel's construction, most rooms have no view of the beach or the ocean unless you are in the premium building facing the ocean. The rest of the rooms do not have any view and do not offer much privacy (all windows are facing the walkway so you have to keep curtains down pretty much the entire time while you are in room unless you don't mind having strangers look at you while you are in the room.) However, since the hotel is located right on the beach and San Diego boasts sunny weather most of the year, chances are you are not going to sit in your room anyways. The beach is just steps away and so are numerous restaurants and cafes. Everything in this location is a walking distance, which is so worth it! The rooms inside the hotel are sparkling clean and everything quite inviting and relaxing. Our standard room had huge flat screen TV, walk-in closet with small refrigerator and a microwave. Bathroom was modern with good quality shampoos, soaps and even toothpaste. My only complain is the water pressure in the shower. Trying to wash out sand and sea-salt from long hair proved to be a very long and very frustrating process because water pressure was pretty weak. But, even this minor disappointed did not spoil our stay and I didn't feel like taking off stars from excellent rating for this hotel. Front desk staff was always friendly, courteous and super helpful. Always smiling and enjoying helping customers. Breakfast was basic with just pastries, however includes huge selection of delicious tea, coffee, and papaya juice - yummy! There is a small pool on the premises though we never saw anyone using it because magnificent ocean is just 4 steps away, so I am not sure who would want to sit in the pool anyways. In summary, awesome hotel with superb location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay for The Money at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Jammer1
Reviews.Content: There is no way to say adequately how much I love this little hotel secret in San Diego. I've been visiting there now for over a decade, and it is still my preferred stop in San Diego at the beach. There are definitely swankier, more expensive hotels, and if you want to be right on the water then this won't do it for you... BUT if you want a reasonably-priced place that is literally fall-out-of-bed-and-walk-100-yards-to-the-ocean, well, then this is your place. The staff is great, the rooms are clean (and recently refurbished), the location is blocks away from the Crystal Pier and Pacific Beach Nightlife, there are plenty of places to eat and drink within walking distance, and you won't empty your savings account to do it. Lots (LOTS) of beach places are either very pricey/swanky or flea traps in Southern California. This is neither! As long as you don't stay at the couple of rooms in the hotel nearest Mission Boulevard (street noise can be distracting in those 2 rooms) then the place is very quiet and laid-back. Don't go however during Spring Break (most of March) - lots of kids partying at the hotel then (unless you're a kid and you WANT to party at the hotel.) Read the review by gandjowen - they have said this even better than I have! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM”
Reviews.Author: gandjowen
Reviews.Content: This location is best on Pacific Beach. We stayed a few years ago and the property was looking tired but was still great value being 2 minutes walk from the Ocean and Boardwalk. The property has been completely renovated with rooms newly decorated,new beds, furniture and flat screen TV's. We stayed in a room in the main block with two queen beds microwave and fridge. The price has also only risen by a few dollars. The staff were all very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is only a Danish Pastry and Coffee which is in the office but this is enough to get you going in the morning and there are plenty of breakfast places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Shores Inn - best location, room and value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: 1/2 block from the beach, updated rooms including vaulted ceilings and marble countertops, great service and very reasonable price compared to other properties in the area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Diego. We stayed here in August, 2010 and it seemed cozy and dated, but still a good value. Stayed again in November, 2011 and couldn't have gone better with updated rooms and off season rates.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff but good location”
Reviews.Author: KGtourist
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunate enough to be in San Diego staying at this hotel when the power out happened on 8th September. This affected Southern California, North Mexico and Nevada. While this was obviously an unexpected event, the manager was nowhere to be found and my husband ended up lending the staff a torch. The place was in total confusion and the staff were no help at all.The airport closed and we asked about staying on at the hotel until we knew our night flight the following day was going ahead but you would have thought we'd asked the impossible. In the end we left. Apart from that - the room we had was fine, old but clean enough with plenty of room. There is no real breakfast but the location is great. However as another reviewer has written there are plenty of these motels on this stretch of road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- that's all”
Reviews.Author: Elleea
Reviews.Content: The motel has a great location close to the water/beach and shops/restaurants, the pool area is also very nice.The stuff is very friendly and helpfull. The room we got was big, but boy it so needs a makeover. I really think it will help to paint the room(s) and change/clean the carpet. The bathroom needs a makeover as well. The quality of the room was very poor for the price we payed. I will consider to go back only after a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: P J
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Pacific Shores Inn for a week to 10 day vacation for close to twenty years with a whole group of friends from Tucson, AZ. We used to go in the summer when our kids were young and in school but now we come in September which is a little quieter but still plenty of action near the beach! Two of our sons now live and work in San Diego so we also come several times during the year to visit them and we always stay at Pacific Shores Inn. We love the motel and the staff. They always try to reserve the rooms we request and are very accommodating. There is someone in the office 24/7. We had to bring our two small rescue dogs this year because we had just adopted them and didn't feel we could leave them in a kennel so soon. The motel has a small one time fee for pets and were very dog friendly. The housekeeping and maintenance staff are so helpful and very nice. When we come with our group of friends, we get rooms close together and hang out on the porches, play games and chat. We love the tables right outside our doors. We like to stroll on the beach (dogs are allowed before 9 am and after 6 pm) We walk to restaurants and shopping and love the boardwalk strolls. We have never had an issue with unpleasant guests or staff. We are so happy to call Pacific Shores our home away from home in San Diego! The Jorgensen Family

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Wonderful Location, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: whatwouldruthdo
Reviews.Content: We got a wonderful deal on a King suite, which even had an ocean view from the kitchen of the room.The room was very nicely updated and clean and offered everything we needed for our week long vacation in the San Diego area. It was wonderful to be able to walk about 40 feet from our room and be at Pacific Beach. You won't have a lot of privacy here, as the rooms are all in close proximity and people are constantly walking by, but it's well worth it for the proximity to the ocean and the rest of what Pacific Beach has to offer. Although PB has a reputation for being a party area, we're not at that stage of our lives anymore and still loved staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if your a surfer”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover64
Reviews.Content: Okish hotel. Some things have been updated but the interiors could do with a revamp. Shower painfully slow even after prompt attention from the maintenance man. Brilliant place for surfers I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: AZPenguin
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for cheap, clean motel near Mission area, this is a good option. Nothing fancy about it. But good location for walking the beach/boardwalk, walking to bars, cheap taxi rides home. Was about $30 to taxi to downtown one-way, which is fine with me when comparing this to the crazy costs of staying in hotels near Gaslamp. I love the low-key feel of the Mission area and all the local non-chain bars and restaurants. Not the place to stay if you are looking for anything more than a place to sleep/clean up.

Reviews.Title: “No intimity whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: MoMoBcn
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the price right. However, you have no intimity whatsoever in your own room. Our room was at street level with two big windows in the two front walls. The motel provides you with an exterior table and chairs, which is nice. However, your neighbor's table is right in front of one of your windows, which is very awkward. Basically, they can't help looking into your room. We had two families with kids next to our room and it was a very uncomfortable. Besides, the housekeeping maids, although they are nice, they seem to be always in a hurry to make your room. One morning they knocked at our room's door at 9h30 to see if we were inside. We were sleeping as we went to sleep late that night (we were on vacation!). Too bad but it is a very uncomfortable place. We would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Cute”
Reviews.Author: madneyc
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was its location...A skip to the beach and the pacific ocean!!!! But the staff was friendly and the safe, cozy scaled down atmosphere made me feel relaxed and at home. I got a real early "60's retro vibe from the place. Maybe they should do some retro interiors..... I do not care for all of the "pomp and circumstance" of the big chain hotels which feel phoney and fake to me. This little inn should reley on its strenghts - that its basically on the beach and it offers a friendly, quiet and relaxed atmosphere thats accessible to a good time right in the middle of PB - Which we had!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: This location is amazing! The room was an average hotel room, who is spending their vacation in the room anyway? It was nice there was a mini refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room. The bathroom was fine despite the other reviews you may read. Average hotel bathroom, nothing more, certainly nothing less. Nice sitting area outside each room to enjoy coffee/news paper in the morning. I would recommend staying on the upper level because you can hang your beach towels over the side to dry. Parking is fee and we never had a problem finding space even though the hotel was booked to capacity. Check in is later in the day but the staff was willing to hold our bags for us while we were out exploring the town. I will stay here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: 5gerts
Reviews.Content: From the unfriendly front desk, to the room with the fridge in the closet, we were very unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with warm friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: docholiday777
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with warm friendly staff. Especially enjoyed the waffles at breakfast ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jclay0920
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at the Pacific Shores Inn when we are in town visiting family. It is a nice, clean motel without any frills. It's great that it's only a block from the beach and some shopping, and within driving distance of everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a the price, would recommend! Best location!”
Reviews.Author: christinelalala
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose this place for our 7 days trip to SD. We were very pleased with the locations. Close to tons of restaurants (chains but also great little restaurants with patio near the ocean) It's not a 5 stars hotel and they don't pretend to be but the room was clean, the shower and bathroom were clean too (i'm picky). The best thing about this place is definitly the price and the location. Almost on the beach and steps away from the bus stop to Old Town Transit center. This hotel is the best place to stay if like us, you are on a budget but want to have a clean room and great service too. Being in San Diego, you want to be outside all the time anyway so why pay for an expensive room you'll only sleep in. Only down side, the breakfast. That's not a breakfast. A few muffins and not so good pastries doesn't qualify.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: heidigib01
Reviews.Content: Freindly service, large clean rooms. short walk to beutiful views overlooking the ocean. near shopping and activities but just far enough to be able to get away from crowds

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Pacific Shores Inn”
Reviews.Author: paraclete
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, exceptional management (I spoke with Jim when booking over the phone), and very near the beach as advertised. Our rooms were 2nd floor non-ocean view, with lofty ceilings and elegant, pleasant decor. Pacific Shores has taken pains to make the rooms comfortable and classy, and I was thrilled that we booked with them. I would definitely stay will them in the future if the rates remain so competitive. Once we parked, we barely had to drive anywhere, the location is great - and guests of the hotel don't have to pay extra for parking - many hotels near the beach do. I thought the beds were incredibly comfortable; I normally wake in hotel beds missing my own, but I slept very well at Pacific Shores. All in all, we really enjoyed our 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but crowded with 5 guest to a room”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCraig
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in San Diego. Happy with the position of the hotel, very quiet, close to the beach and only a short walk to a couple of places to eat, shops etc. Room was a bit small for a family of 5, with two queen beds and a rollaway bed. When the rollaway bed was out, you struggled to get past it to the bath room. Very small bathroom, but it was servicable. Breakfast was typical hotel style, although on occasions during our stay they did run out of orange juice and pastries on separate occasions. Think that it would suit 2 couples more than a family of 2 adults and 3 kids. You would be better looking at a suite

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flyingbnm
Reviews.Content: We were at a different hotel, and left to stay at this hotel. Better location. Better bed. Better staff. Just a block from the beach, near a beautiful park, there was plenty of parking very close to the room. Jim Silver, the manager, was very gracious and friendly. Everyone we met was warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “all in all a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorwayMilkshake
Reviews.Content: The hotel was mostly clean. Twice I experienced that there was hair on the clean towel and the bed, I did that the satisfaction was slightly smaller. But I was sitting outside the hotel room one day they washed, and it seemed as if they do a good job. They should be more careful while cleaning, because they destroyed my perfume on one day, but since I had no proof of who had done it, I didnt said anything to the managment.. Disappointed with the breakfast, but it was a typical American breakfast of muffins and dounuts, not ideal for the Europeans, who wants real food. Fortunately, a refrigerator in the room, so we bought the oatmeal and milk, so it was breakfast. The hotel is centrally located at pacific beach, restaurants, supermarkets and shopping area. Recommend anyone to take a ride on Imperial Beach, about 30 minutes by car from the hotel. This will bring you all the way to Mexico border. Near here is also a shopping outlet, several shops with good deals. Nice with a table and chairs outside the hotel room, and a free parcing space.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!! Will stay there again! =)”
Reviews.Author: finzfan98
Reviews.Content: The front desk was really friendly and very helpful. It was steps to the beach, we loved that! The room was clean, the pool was great! We will definately stay there again. The area was amazing. Close to everything, shopping, restaurants....and all the locals are always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “the locations was perfect”
Reviews.Author: donnaleavitt
Reviews.Content: the location was awesome. We parked the car, in the FREE parking spot and did not drive until we left San Diego to return home 5 days later. Within walking distance to the beach, bike rental, local markets, restaurants and the bus stop was in front of the hotel. We took the bus to Sea World

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, but not the best hotel for traveling with small kids”
Reviews.Author: Family0three
Reviews.Content: After reading very strong reviews about this hotel, we were a little disappointed in the room. Our main gripe was that there is no bath, so giving a child a bath is not an option. We asked if there were any rooms that had a bath/shower combination and were told no, all of them had showers only. I wanted to post that on here in case people who are traveling with small children know that - especially since you spend time on the beach (which is really close) and the kids get full of sand. The hotel room was clean, but nothing fancy. The continental breakfast had muffins, doughnuts, coffee and juice. I was disappointed not to see any fruit or oatmeal, since these are staples for my toddler. Overall, it was very clean and really close to the beach, and didn't take long to get to places in San Diego. I'd recommend to couples or families with older kids who want to spend time on the beach, but I don't recommend this for families with small kids since the breakfast isn't too balanced and the lack of bath/shower combination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with ideal position right by Mission Beach”
Reviews.Author: mylesclough
Reviews.Content: Recently re-painted outside but older decor in the rooms. Very clean and well maintained by friendly, helpful staff. Good location with the beach just a step away. Many surfers use this place. Bus access to Old Town and downtown goes from right outside the hotel but takes about an hour. Lots of local eating places and supermarket within walking distance. Breakfast of juice, coffee and Danish was not that great. We stayed there during a conference at the SD Convention Center. It took half an hour to get there by car and 90 mins by public transport. Our room was close to Mission Blvd so was noisy but not unduly so.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Perfect location. Great for kids."”
Reviews.Author: MorleysMom
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite with a kitchenette. Our room also had a lovely balcony with a view of the ocean. We were traveling with a 1.5 YO and a 3.5 YO and the location could not have been any better. They loved the pool, and going to the beach every day. We loved being able to walk everywhere and to catch the sunset every evening. The beach was literally a 2 minute walk. It is a short drive to Sea World. It's close to highways to get to the Wild Animal Park, the Zoo and other attractions. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: zombielova
Reviews.Content: We came to see a band play a few blocks down and were amazed by the hotel, and how close it was to the beach, nightlife spots and great restaurants. The front desk clerk was very nice and the rooms were more than I expected for a hotel less than a few hundred yards from the beach. The rooms were cozy, had a refrigerator and microwave, the little amenities were very nice, and the beds were comfortable. We woke up to the sound of the surf early in the morning, which was awesome. There could stand to be a little more lighting in the rooms, but besides that, everything was great. I would definately recommend the hotel and plan on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “WINTER WONDERLAND”
Reviews.Author: Scottysgirl01
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at PACIFIC SHORES INN. Last January we visited and booked again this year because we were so delighted with the property. Travelling with two small dogs can be difficult and staying here made it quite easy. There is a reasonable fee of course, but everyone was kind and open to their presence. We had 3 adults staying in a ground floor room with two queen beds. There was plenty of room, the room was clean, there was a frig, coffee maker and micro wave. Great place to travel with young children. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful, housekeeping staff was cheerful and available to help with extra towels, etc. What more could you want from a beach front hotel with the most beautiful winter sunsets off the San Diego coast? We wil be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: thehunnybunnys
Reviews.Content: We checked in on New Year's Eve and checked out on January 2, 2011. We paid a little over $200, which wasn't, we split one night in half with another couple. We arrived at about 4 PM, and got good parking, right in front of our room. If we would of arrived a little later I would have not taken that good of a parking. Front desk issues two parking spaces per room, they issue a parking pass. We got a two-queen bed suite. Right outside our door there is a white patio table with three chairs- PERFECT! Once you walk in, there's the two beds, a couch, a chair, coffee table, really big flat screen TV, a dresser, the dresser between the beds with an alarm clock, telephone and lamp. There is a walk in closet, the bathroom has a big mirror, a shower/tub. The thing that impressed us the most was the kitchenette! There were two burners ("stove"), small sink, small fridge, a dining table with three chairs, and! a dining set, complete with spoons, forks, plates! It's amazing! We really though we got great value for the price we paid. We made it down to the pool on Saturday night just to BBQ some steaks. The pool goes down to nine feet, not bad, it's a good size. We got a great view of the Pacific Ocean from our room/balcony. I am planning to come back anytime I decide to come back to Pacific Beach! :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value and location”
Reviews.Author: aspens
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our three night stay; cannot beat the location: 50-100 yards from the beach. Even though we only had a partial view of the ocean in room 37, for the price (~$80) we could not ask for more. The only negative was that the bathroom did not have an exhaust fan, but it did have a window. Lot of places to eat and shops within easy walking distance. Fairly quiet and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, clean and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnneScache
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find a spacious, clean room with flat scree TV, refrigerator and microwave in each suite. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The best surprise was the beds. Most comfortable beds I have found in a hotel in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad management”
Reviews.Author: stevew02044
Reviews.Content: The price is good for the location and the rooms are decent. My problem was that I booked a room for one night and I left the next morning at 7am and just left the keys on the table instead of checking out at the front desk (I was in a hurry). I check my credit card statement a week later and find out they charged me for 2 nights. I called 5 times in order to get them to reverse the extra day charge and every time they said the manager wasn't there and he would call me back. Finally 10 days later the manager calls me. He was rude, unaplogetic about the 10 day response period and said it wasn't his fault that he didn't get the messages before (way to take responsibility for your employees). Then he implies that I am lying and stayed there an extra night secretly. I'm not sure if he's running a scam or if he and the staff are just incompetent, but either way, beware if you ever have to deal with the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average but you get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: gadgt69
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest place i've ever stayed, the room felt a bit run down even though i think they've recently been renovated. That said they were clean and the beach is just down the way. Cars were parked right next to our door which we didn't like and some of the front desk staff weren't particularly helpful. Plenty of decent restaurants around, especially on the seafront. I'd definitely recommend the hop on hop off tour that leaves from old town. Be sure to get off at coranado island, we loved it there!! Overall we loved san diego and were hardly in the room so it didn't really matter that much to us!

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Lynnep_Willerby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 8th September to 13th 2010. We arrived late after a long flight from the UK. We were checked in immediately and although our initial booking was for twin beds because that's all they had left at the time, they offered to change this for us. The rooms were great, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The only complaint was the shower door did not fit properly and water sprayed through a gap to leave the bathroom floor very wet and slippery so we kept having to put towels on the floor. Apart from this Jim Silver and his staff were brilliant. The receptionist even charged my ipod up for me whilst I went to dinner so that I could go for my early morning run with music. The coffee was good and the pastries even better. The pool was clean, the location is 1 min walk to the beach and plenty to do nearby and many places to eat and shop. I have no hesitation in recommending this place, clearly it was very popular as it was fully booked the weekend of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: abtravel4fun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay in San Diego at Pacific Shores Inn. The location is excellent - steps away from the beach and close to restaurants, etc! Good pool too. The room was a nice size, and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. It was nice having a fridge, microwave and coffee pot (have to ask for coffee at the office). We went out for breakfast each day so didn't really take advantage of the pastries in the office - just grabbed a muffin one day. Everyone was friendly and the rooms were well cleaned. Given the location and the price compared to other places in the area, we would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in July or August”
Reviews.Author: scott-az-53
Reviews.Content: Pacific Beach is a crazy place in July and August and this hotel is usually sold out. But at $189 per night, it's definitely not a bargain because there's so much noise and ruckus going on you won't get a good night's sleep and definitely won't be able to nap during the day, especially if you keep your window open to enjoy the cool ocean breeze. There's only two hours where it's reasonable quiet around this place; from 2:30 am to 4:30 am. The rest of the time you're going to hear slamming car and hotel room doors, couples arguing with each other, drunken partiers, barking dogs, mischievous children screaming and running all over the place, harleys and hopped-up cars doing jackrabbit starts on Mission Blvd., garbage trucks, Federal Express trucks on delivery, car alarm systems going off, landscapers with leaf-blowers, lawnmowers and weed-eaters beginning at 6:00 am., honking car horns and stereo systems, helicopters, airplanes, skateboarders pounding the sidewalks, and other assorted noises. Whatever you do, do not stay in a room on the south side of the hotel because the noise is twice as bad.

Reviews.Title: “they try..”
Reviews.Author: Hotellybelly
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel early august 2009 with a friend and my family. The cost was great, it was $87 a night then but i see the price has gone up quite a bit and im not sure i would pay any more than i payed. When we got there no one was at the front desk and we found a maid outside who went in and got a key for us which we were a little concerned about (isnt the manager supposed to do this?) the room was really humid and had very bad air conditioning but it did come with a box fan, and the floor was really sandy but i understand this because you walk outside and the whole parking lot is covered in it. When we first got in the room we were a little confused as to where the promised microwave and fridge was and we found them hiding in the closet, which im not sure i liked because it was a cramped space and only 1 person could fit in at a time. Also we knew they didnt have a coffee maker in the room so we brought our own but there were no availabe plugs left in the closet and most of the ones in the room itself did not work so we had to unplug our microwave. and the bathroom is tiny i mean REALLY tiny! just a shower sink and travel trailor sized toilet and the window next to the toilet had no shade and opened up to a back ally where many kids would walk through and peek through them so we had to put a towel over it. The maids made sure the rooms got cleaned at least twice a day which was nice to be able to leave for the beach (which is right next to the hotel) and come back to a clean room. The pool was very green and smelled of pee in the area but it did have a shower to use after the beach so you wouldnt have to use the public one on the beach. One day we did have a 20 dollar bill go missing but we didnt complain because we were not sure if it was the maid or one of our family members who had taken it. Anyways the bed was comfy the coffee in the lobby was great and there was plenty of resteraunts and shopping right outside the hotel, if i go back to san diego and can get the same price i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot next to PB”
Reviews.Author: Arizona1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week as well as in December two years ago and we love this place. I feel that it is a little pricey for the amenities but the location is fabulous and perhaps why they charge what they do. You are literally steps to Pacific Beach. The rooms are basic but have a refrigerator and a microwave which is nice. My only real complaint is that our headboards on each of the two queen beds were very loose and banged into the wall behind us every time we moved which was annoying. We will certainly stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel by the Beach”
Reviews.Author: whitethrone1
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Shores Inn is a great budget hotel by the beach. Check-In: We booked through Expedia and got a rate with a coupon of $87 per night. When I arrived at the hotel check-in took no more than 5 minutes and our rooms was ready to go in the location we requested through Expedia. We requested a room on the end of the hotel closest to the beach. It also ended up right across from the pool. The Room: It was recently remodeled so everything looked new. The bed was amazingly comfortable and made for a great night's sleep! The room itself could have been a little larger as the door to the room hit the bed when you opened it. There was ample room at the ends of the beds though (we had 2 queens). The room had a separate room that was a closet/microwave/fridge room. This was nice as we stored our luggage and food in there which got it out of the way. The bathroom was very clean and updated. However, it was a bit small though. It also only had a shower (no tub). Very small counter space for the sink. We also had a flat panel TV with cable, a large dresser, and a small breakfast table with 2 chairs. Overall, the room suited us pretty well as we stayed there 4 nights with a 1 year old and a 4 year old. The room could have used a bit more lighting, but it wasn't really a problem. The main thing is that the beds were pillow-top and super comfortable. Other Amenities: The pool area was very nice and had a gas grill for use. The pool was "heated" but barely. So swimming in May was not a super easy task. The breakfast was probably the only major disappointment. Even to call it continental is a bit of a stretch. It basically consisted of a small selection of pastries, watered down coffee, and pulpy orange juice. Nothing more. Also note that the rooms have coffeemakers but if you want to make coffee you have to go to the front desk and get coffee, creamer, and cups. However, they give you as much as you ask for. Location: Incredible location for the price! There is only one small condo building between the hotel and the beach. It takes about 3 minutes to be on the beach after a walk down the ramp/steps at the end of the street. And there are many restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. So all in all...an amazing deal if you can get it for under $100. Right by the beach, nicely updated rooms, and plenty to do within walking distance or a short drive.

Reviews.Title: “Charming inn close to attractions, can see ocean from balcony!”
Reviews.Author: FunintheSun111
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room with kitchenette, 2 doubles and sofa sleeper. Quite roomy, cute with patio set on balcony outside room. Can walk down to beach, within 1 block away. Numerous restaurants, shops within walking distance also. Continental breakfast scant, with coffee and sweets, but only negative I experienced there. Kitchen had full size stove and fridge. Easy drive to seaworld and maritime museum. Unfortunately weather was cold and rainy during our 3 days there, so put a damper on our visit. Didn't get to see as much as we wanted to. We loved the maritime museum and harbor cruise and my boys couldn't get enough of the USS Midway museum! I would definately return to this nice little inn!

Reviews.Title: “A great value at the beach in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: maroselewis
Reviews.Content: The location was great go out the back of the hotel and you are at the beach. The staff is very friendly. The beds were very comfortable slept great. The rooms are a little dark but would not keep us from coming back. Very affordable for staying at the beach. Pool would be fine but not the reason to stay.

Reviews.Title: “the location was great for the beach goer”
Reviews.Author: neslolo
Reviews.Content: for the cost it was ok - the place is older. The water pressure in the shower sucked.It is just a block from the beach so a nice place to walk -

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rinny_rem
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at this motor lodge. It's an older renovated motel. The staff is very friendly, the room was clean and nicely appointed. I asked for an upstairs room so that I could catch a glimpse of the ocean and was accomodated without hesitation. Only 2 things that were unusual - 1) coffee makers in the room but no coffee and 2) only one bar of soap in the bathroom was provided for the 3 day stay so we had to transfer the soap between the sink and shower as needed - I guess it's a good way not to be wasteful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: justintch
Reviews.Content: The Inn is located in an ideal spot for enjoying Mission and Pacific Beaches as well as La Jolla and downtown attractions. It is within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. It is also 1/2 block from the surf of Pacific Beach. Rooms are simple but nicely appointed. A generous continental breakfast is provided. Management is friendly and very helpful. This is a superior value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best place by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Surfer120
Reviews.Content: I loved this beach hotel. Me and some friends were looking for a great place to stay in Pacific Beach and came found this place online. The price was great for being so close to the beach and the room was fantastic. I will always stay here when coming to Pacific Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Open the window at night and hear the waves crashing on the shore”
Reviews.Author: Scrimshaw
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel on business, I try to stay by the beach, if there is one, even if this means sacrificing the amenities of a business hotel. For me, this place ticks all the boxes. Room is big enough and comfortable. There is TV and wifi. Free parking. The staff are friendly and this place is right on Pacific Beach, San Diego's finest strand. Bedroom-surf is two minutes flat, maybe less. You are a couple of blocks away from the bars of 'central' PB too, so quiet, save for the noise of the waves crashing on the sand.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, near ocean”
Reviews.Author: acjjj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Shores Inn on Mission Blvd. The room was clean, beds were comfortable. Found the flat foam pillows not great. Room was spacious for the 2 of us. We were on the top floor and away from the road so had no noise complaints. Complaints we did have, were quickly dealt with: Initially we were in a room that had soaking wet towels neatly hung over the towel bar. When I called to request new towels, they whisked us to a new upgraded room! After 3 days of very cool showers, I talked to the front desk and the water temperature was quickly adjusted. The pool was closed when we were there so cannot comment on it. The best part about the hotel was its proximity to the beach, just 1/2 block away. We had great walks along the ocean boardwalk. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Near beach, had a nice time with a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: jfor975
Reviews.Content: Pacific Shores has the nearby beach going for it. That said, if you want to be more centrally located to the main San Diego area you may be disappointed here. It is just off of Pacifc Beach which is directly North of Mission beach. They are both just North of Mission Bay and Sea World. That means they are also well North of the San Diego harvour area, the downtown and Blaboa Park. We found the drive to Sea World to be easy with routes to Mission Bay right down Mission Boulvard or over Grand Street to Ingrahm Ave. We tried the beach both off of the motel at pacific beach and down near Belmont Park on Mission beach. The Mission beach area is a little better for kids. Both are well patroled by lifeguards and the ocean surf is warm and fun to play in. We spent three nights at Pacific Shores. The motel is going through some "growing" pains with upgrading going on. One afternoon after returnign from the beach we were kept oput of returnign to our room while maintenance was replacing a light switch with sensor switch. This was late in the afternoon at a time when they should expect the guests may want to return to thier rooms. The timing was bad. The last night we spent the smoke alarm batery gave out around midnight and the device began emitting loud alarms. A call to thew dsk brought someont tot eh room aroun 1:00AM, We had to small boys with us trying to sleep. The man replaced the bsattery in the smoke dector and wehn away. A hald horu later it began letting off a short blast every hour or so for the rest of the night! We has a restless night and the kids were not happy. Complaining to the manager lead to the expalnation that the battery was probably not put in properly, sorry about that. No adjustment was offered on our rate but he did say if we come back again to call him and he would give us a better rate next time. Overall while the location may be out of the way to some we enjoyed the proximity of the beaches, the overall casual atmosphere of the area. The motel manager also mentioned that upgrades are planned to replace the pool area and improve the overall motel. The cost is reasonable, the weather is always great and if that darn smoke alarm goes off put the battery in yourself!

Reviews.Title: “not cheap but good”
Reviews.Author: ferdinando_pucci
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the beach, you can go there with the surfboard under the arm. Very clean room and bathroom, with kitchen (fridge, freezer, oven). There is a pool. Small take-away breakfast. We stayed few days, before travelling back to Italy. It was the last period of our holiday and we run out of the credit card limit. Of course we payed in cash, but the owner of the inn was very brute with this, leading us to be quite anxious. For this reason we do not suggest this inn to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: locatelli
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Pacific Shores Inn. We found the location excellent being very close to the beach.There were many shops, restaurants and public transport within a short walking distance. The noise from the second story rooms could clearly be heard in the downstairs rooms. Fortunately we had quiet people above us most of the time. There was a great continental breakfast of coffee, juice and Danish pastries included in the price. The rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great value for beach location!”
Reviews.Author: alicat1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel, not knowing what to expect due to the extremely reasonable price for a hotel located right on the beach in North PB. The staff was very friendly and let us check in early. There was ample free parking, the room was HUGE! there was a walk in closet with mini fridge, a nice walk in bathroom (not like hotels where the sink is right in the room) with modern appliances and a great walk-in shower with good water pressure. there was a lot of natural light from all the windows, so we could feel the ocean breeze all day/night. huge flat screen TV, dresser, table and chairs...the room really had everything you needed. it was very clean and quiet as well. the hotel also has a pool and hot tub. and it has a quaint feel since it's not a large hotel, i should probably call it a motel actually. our room was on the second floor and we had a small table and chairs outside our room on the balcony, where we could see a sliver of the ocean and watch the sunset. in walking distance to everything PB has to offer, and did i mention right on the beach?? beautiful running trails on the boardwalk, literally just steps from the motel. you can rent bikes to bike ride on the boardwalk or walk down the beach a little to rent surfboards. also a quick drive to the bay where you rent kayaks. i would highly recommend this to anyone - families, couples, friends. may not be ideal if you want to be right in the heart of the hustle and bustle of mission beach, but that's where the younger kids and tourists hang out and it's a little crazier the closer you get to Belmont Park and i personally like being in walking distance to that stuff but to have a quiet room to go back to, and a bit of a more relaxing, scenic beach (i.e. no crazy drunks at the bars near my hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpised”
Reviews.Author: rwheeler50
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much based on the sketchy reviews I'd read. But we were pleasantly surpised. The room was very large and clean. With the air conditioner on we had no problem with noise at night ( we were half way down on the 2nd floor). We were very pleased with our experience. The only negative was a weird half wall for the shower which which meant the floor got wet and it took 5 minutes for the shower to warm up each morning. And if you want to get picky I prefer to be closer to the pier and restaurants. But for the price this was a great deal in June.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable comfort right off the beach”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTater
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find such a nice place just paces from the beach at such a reasonable rate. I booked through the hotel website and received the most affordable rate with the AAA discount. The rooms were simple but comfortable with updated furniture, fridge/micro, very large flatscreen TV and a walk in shower with bath & body works products. There were 2 queen beds which were very comfortable as well. I had an upstairs unit with a partial ocean view. I was traveling solo and had no issues whatsoever. The staff was young, but hospitable. The pool could use a good coat of paint at the bottom (but the beach is right there so who cares!?) and the breakfast was ok...but I'd take breakfast at The Mission over muffins & coffee anyday! Additional perk: free parking!! Rent a bike for the day and it makes the stay well worth the trip. All in all, a great place for the price, especially with it's close proximity to PB.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Free parking, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ProudNavyMom
Reviews.Content: I researched Trip Advisor as well as other internet reviews to find a hotel at a reasonable rate that offered location, amenities (microwave, refrigerator, iron) and also positive feedback on cleanliness. I also found that most of the lodging facilities in the area charged up to $20 a day for parking. We found what we were looking for at the Pacific Shores Inn. I made reservations in January and called twice before we arrived to make sure they could accommodate my second floor request as far away from the main road and closer towards the beach as possible. We checked in around 2 p.m. on Tuesday and were told our room was on the first floor. I reminded the clerk, who was extremely friendly, that I had requested otherwise. She then offered us a room on the second floor - but it was on the end right next to the road. She stated this was all they had available. I was quite disappointed and respectfully asked why my request hadn't been granted. She went to the back and spoke with someone and then offered to upgrade us. We were put on the 2nd floor about 2/3 the way down from the road. The room was very nice! Quite large with cathedral ceiling, lovely color scheme, comfortable beds, new flatscreen tv, floor to ceiling glass doors of which the ocean could be seen. The shower stall was exactly as reported on this web site; new but only half enclosed by glass and yes the water did spray all over the floor after showering. Just be sure to lay down a towel. :) We had no problems with any noise - and I am a VERY light sleeper. Now for the nitty gritty...the carpet had several large dark stains and was dirty enough to discolor white sox. Nothing a good shampooing couldn't cure. There was no where to put your toiletries in the shower except on the floor. Perhaps some wire shelf hangers to slip over the shower nozzle could be purchased? And twice the maid had left our fresh towels sitting on the toilet which was rather unpleasant. The other 3 times they were hung and fanned out. As for the pool; we would not swim - nor did we see anyone else swim - as there was a significant amount of algae on the bottom. Again - the things I mentioned are easy fixes that just need some attention from management. We would stay here again. Be SURE to walk the boardwalk about 4 blocks to Kono's for breakfast! Great way to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego...just sleep on the beach / plane”
Reviews.Author: one4music658
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my overall stay here. The room I had was very nice...updated and spacious. The is literally steps to the beach...there's just a small apartment complex between the beach and the hotel. In front of the apartment complex is a beachfront running path. The area the hotel is in is great...a couple convenience / grocery stores a couple blocks away as well as some happening night life. My main complaint about the hotel is that the rooms are not well insulated. I was woken up each morning from the first risers slamming doors...and kids being kids...and I even had ear plugs in! All the room doors face the center parking area. While being sleep deprived on vacation sucks...I don't think I'd trade in the location, value, and condition of the hotel for a quieter place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice get away”
Reviews.Author: castrofam02
Reviews.Content: Great location almost on the beach maybe 20 paces off . Great service , good staff I've spent some time on the road on business and look forward to a nice place off the major Routes a nice relaxing spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that....”
Reviews.Author: snappyrivera
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thru a pet friendly hotel site. I chose this hotel coz i have a puppy with me. I was told on the phone that a $50.00 deposit was required. But when I got there, they charged me $200.00 for deposit plus payment for the room. I told the concierge that i was told it was only $50.00, but that was not the case, a deposit of $200.00 was required. The room was clean. The downside is there is no Wifi. Cable tv channels are very limieted. No HBO, but HBO was listed in their channels offered. I would never stay here again. The staff is incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive”
Reviews.Author: travelingman59
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in January 2009. The positives: good location, free parking, friendly staff, very easy beach access, rooms clean, big (30"+) flat screen tv, bathroom recently remodeled, free coffee, juice, and muffins in the lobby each morning. Now it's time to get nitpicky: room 28. Two light switches at front door, could not figure out what they controlled.They did nothing each time I flipped them in either direction. Electrical outlet under view window: dead. Light switch in large walk-in closet did not work. Floor lamp in closet worked if you unplugged the microwave or refrigerator in there. Coffee maker in closet, but never received coffee, filters or cups (so why bother putting a coffee maker in the room?) There were four items in the closet that needed electricity, but only two outlets. Bathroom newly remodeled and nicely tiled, but shower head was mounted at least 10 inches too low and room had a strong mildew smell that did not go away. The two beds in the room did not seem to be queen sized. More likely full size, so you will be very snug sharing the bed. So there are details that the management needs to work on, but even with all of the minor annoyances I would still stay here again. Good value for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Misspotatohead
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a road trip around California. The main reason for booking was for the beach and price, given how expensive accommodation is in downtown San Diego and we were on a budget. We weren't disappointed as the room was clean and a decent size, with 2 queen beds, table/chairs and sofa plus a small kitchen. There is also a small on-site self service laundrette which was handy. Therefore you would be comfortable staying for a longer period of time if need be. On site parking was available and free, something you wouldn't necessarily get if staying downtown. There is also a small pool which is in reasonable condition. If you're keen on surfing or the beach scene, then the Pacific Shores is an added bonus as the beach is a minute walk away. We enjoyed a walk along the boardwalk although there weren't as many shops/restaurants as we expected. Downtown is a 15/20 min drive away, La Jolla is 5/10 mins in the opposite direction. There are plenty of bars/restaurants within walking distance from Pacific Shores which attract a younger, surfing crowd. If you're looking for a decent breakfast, go to Hennesey's (also saw some fab live music one evening there), and if you're a fan of burgers you must pop into the Kiwi bar. Pacific Shores was excellent value for money and conveniently located. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Was Very Good”
Reviews.Author: girl100
Reviews.Content: very good hotel. great amenites (pool, microwave, fridge) great location(one house from the beach) extremely well sized modern clean rooms. Very inexpensive (we paid $99 a night for four people!)

Reviews.Title: “Plan to return, great location, Excellent price”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSusan
Reviews.Content: See Wacky in Toronto's last paragraph (Sept. 9, 2008).... This is not a romantic place, it's a very functional place at a great price in a great location. I booked it solely based on reviews read here. We paid AAA rate of around $90. for week-end and $85. for week days. We had a top floor room (it's a 2 floor motel) with 2 queen beds and a partial view of the ocean (room 35). I booked with the hotel directly and was told that a partial ocean view was their maximum view. This was the case. We stayed 6 nights. Our bathroom was completely renovated with a window that opened. Beds were comfortable, Towels & toiletries better than you'd think at this price. A/C noisy but we ran it during the day when we weren't there and turned it off at night. The room had a ceiling fan, which was sufficient. FYI - outiside temperature was around 80 - 90 degrees F. during our stay. We had an outside table with seating. The balcony is like this: a long open area that fronts your room and all the adjoining rooms. If you have one of the first rooms in the row, you will have people walking right past your outside area. If you have the last room in the row, you have total privacy. Each room door is slightly angled so that you don't see your neighbour when sitting outside. No problem with maid service, parking or noise. Our room was probably 3/4 of the way down through the property (in the direction of the beach) so we were probably a bit further from the main road than many rooms. We could hear the ocean though! I didn't see any other rooms however, I think it's fair to say that some might not be in an ideal spot on the property, i.e. with the front of my car parked up against their front door. I found the front desk staff very good on the phone and in person, my travelling companion found some of the evening staff less than helpful. They weren't surly; they just didn't know anything! The boardwalk and beach is a 30 second walk from the property.

Reviews.Title: “OK not great”
Reviews.Author: knml911
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there. Room was decent and clean. I did not like the location of the motel though, it was a very busy street and as there was no air conditioning in the room, we had to leave the patio door open so it was a bit noisy. Next time, I'd rather pay a little more to get a more modern room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “decent motel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wacky
Reviews.Content: It is what it is – a decent, clean motel, and the price/value ratio was excellent for a budget beach-side stay. We booked a 3 night stay on hotelclub.ca at about $100/night incl taxes. Nervous after reading horrible reviews about this internet agency, I emailed them to double check that the reservation is indeed confirmed – thankfully it was and we checked in no problem. Based on tripadvisor reviews I also called ahead to request an upper floor renovated room – we got it. Front desk was very friendly. The keying machine was broken so she let us in with the master key. No elevator so we had to take our 3 large pieces of luggage up the stairs ourselves. Not a problem for us young ones but older folk would have difficulty. We were given 2 queen beds for the 2 of us. Upon request of a king we learned that the property only had 2 kings, and they were both taken. Ah well. The carpet was a bit damp for some reason, and though the suite was half way into the property we could hear traffic from the busy road. However the high, pitched ceiling made the room feel more airy and the renovated bathroom was clean and had marble counter, at least. Sliding doors opened up to a Juliette balcony and had enough room for drying beachwear. Complimentary continental breakfast was edible with assortment of pastries, coffee and juices. San Diego water is pretty rough so any beverage made with tap water had a fishy taste. No internet access which was a big bummer. Well, they had dial up apparently but no instructions. Free parking was nice. Best part was proximity to the beach, which was fantastic but beware of the piles of washed up seaweed aka bug hives. All in all, don’t book this place for a romantic get-away, but it’s a fantastic no-frills option for budget travelers who rather spend time exploring beautiful San Diego than hang out in a motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a young beach/surf loving dude”
Reviews.Author: Jules009
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (2 adults, 11 and 9 year olds) and we stayed in a twin room in this hotel in late August. The hotel facilities are modest; small lobby, small pool, laundry room (and this is where all the San Diego and trip info can be found) coffee and pastries for breakfast, and on-site, free parking. The receptionist was very helpful especially in helping me locate my handbag which I'd left at a restaurant somewhere on the freeway!The rooms are spacious with a small kitchen area with fridge and microwave but no utensils or crockery and the room and bathroom was clean. It is ideally placed for Pacific Beach which was literally a 100 yards away and has big waves for body-surfing. It is a short drive from Seaworld and the zoo. Despite its location, it was quiet at night. If you like typical, fast food outlets and bars, this hotel is ideally placed - if not you will need to travel to find something a little more cultural.

Reviews.Title: “Very average down-market motel”
Reviews.Author: Wilson080
Reviews.Content: Booked this motel for a three night stay in SD after reading favourable reviews but was sadly disappointed. The decor was tired, dated and the room smelled stale. Every day both key cards failed and once we had to wait outside for 20 mins late at night before the receptionist returned to sort this out. The area around the motel was not for walking in at night with few restaurants but plenty of rowdy bars and fast food places - not suitable for us with a young daughter. The beach, however, was lovely. Its a bit too far out if you want to spend most of your time in central SD. I would recommend this motel if you want to spend time at the beach and love surfing and are happy with a burger for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTrio3
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this Hotel and it's location is convenient to most attractions. We wanted to stay near the ocean beach - and with a pool. We were just steps away from both. The rooms were spotless and updated beautifully. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We stayed in room 39, second floor at the beach end of the complex. There were 2 chairs outside our room to enjoy the ocean view and smell the ocean air with beverages. Our room had a large walk in closet with fridge, micro and 4 cup coffee pot. But they did not supply the coffee to brew in room. You could walk up to the office in the morning for coffee, juice and pastry. The pastry was just a little average though. As with the last reviewer, the pool was not open at 9 am as posted on the sign. The maintenance guy was still cleaning the pool until about 10 am. The pool was maintained very well though. The room had windows in the front, bathroom and closet, but no screens, so we didn't keep them open at night. The air conditioner worked in the beginning of our 5 night stay, but the wall thermostat broke on the last night. Glad there was a ceiling fan. I reported these two maintenance problems. Overall, we would certainly go back and recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “authentic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant time at this hotel. Staying in room 23, we had a partial view of the ocean with a patio out front with a big table, also with ocean view. We liked sitting out on the patio and watching people come and go, and in the evening, the hotel was like a little town of it's own, with people hanging out on their patio's and balconies, talking and laughing. This was very relaxing and had a very friendly feeling to it. Our beds were very comfortable and only having a shower wasn't a problem at all. We loved having a window in our bathroom. Our room also had a huge closet space, which was great for putting all our clutter in and keeping our room neat. The pool is a bit too small for laps, but it did its job. It was hardly ever crowded, as all people were mostly spending their time at the beach. The only thing that really bothered us was the maintenance guy not getting the pool ready by 9am – and saying he didn’t know it had to open then… with a big sign at the pool virtually screaming out the opening hours. Oh well. All in all we had a great stay, and being able to walk to all the restaurants and the beach was great. Free parking is a great plus as well, although all those huge SUVs and trucks sometimes made parking very tricky. We will definitely stay here again.
